item.description:

item.title: Cigarette butts from the bar customers., 8th July
item.description:
People that drink in the bar, throw their cigarette butts on the floor. So they are all in the road. I expect will end up down the drain when they should be sweeping up after themselves in the morning and in the evenings when theyâ€™re closing up, not just sweeping them into the road.

item.title: Black bins not emptied again, 8th July

item.title: More fly tipping again, same spot, 8th July
item.description:
Mattress dumped against gable wall of C&S Builders & Allison Court, Olinda Road. Dumped sometime between 7pm Saturday 5th July & the morning of Monday 7th. Please be advised C&S have CCTV & culprits could possibly be identified

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Stamford Hill, Hackney, London

item.title: Street light not working since May 23rd 2025, 8th July
item.description:
I have reported this x 4 times since May and have references. Engineer came took out new LED bulb weeks ago and still not returned with a new one !!! The area is dark at night and is ideal for crime!!! Last reported 2/7/25. Was told it would be escalated again.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Machell Road, Nunhead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Craig's Court - dumping ground, 8th July
item.description:
Craig's court full of rubbish yet between commercial buildings on great Scotland Yard- no bin and no rubbish in sight !? if it can be done for a commercial space why can't it be cleaner in front od one of only very few residential buildings !? bin bags dumped by businesses - could it be Walkers of Whitehall - by the bt phone box on Whitehall itself, magical platform and other " tourist shops ' dumping card/ rubbish everywhere nobody seems to care !? if tesco can keep their waste inside surely other businesses should also be made to - how can this be allowed to go on for so long !?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 3-5, Great Scotland Yard, Waterloo, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish outside bt exchange and silver crosd, 8th July
item.description:
Rubbish everywhere vomit feces crushed glass bt exchange fire exit blocked by Walker's of Whitehall patrons- this pub and old shades dump their waste wherever they like and get to profit from using the public space and the council is the only one cleaning it - why ? reported flytipping behind Silver Cross 2 months ago - metal boxing still there - why is it impossible to make this space more clean and businesses more accountable for their action ?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 7, Whitehall, Waterloo, London
Report on FixMyStreet
